messages.message: Hi all -- trying to run `make update-requirements` in 22.10 to fix a vulnerability, but am unable to do so. Has anyone else run into this? Seems to be a problem with cython and/or numpy. I tried a few workarounds, but no dice (https://github.com/numpy/numpy/issues/24377). This is in `webserver/api-server-apps`.
Seems like this problem has been lingering in 22.10 for a while; I only ran into it b/c I tried to update an unrelated dependency.

this fixed it:

```diff --git a/webserver/api-server-apps/requirements.in b/webserver/api-server-apps/requirements.in
index fa510b9bc64..9e64c688593 100644
--- a/webserver/api-server-apps/requirements.in
+++ b/webserver/api-server-apps/requirements.in
@@ -23,7 +23,7 @@ protobuf==3.20.3
 pika==1.3.0
 boto3==1.16.18
 botocore==1.19.63
-sqlparse==0.4.4
+sqlparse~=0.5
 parsimonious==0.8.0
 beautifulsoup4==4.6.0
 pycryptodomex==3.20.0
@@ -80,7 +80,7 @@ oauthlib==3.2.2

 # Pin requirements (to fix vulnerability)
 joblib==1.2.0
-numpy==1.19.0
+numpy~=1.19.4

 pillow==9.3.0
 skl2onnx==1.14.1
@@ -92,3 +92,4 @@ certifi==2024.7.4
 pysftp==0.2.9
 usaddress==0.5.10
 zipcodes==1.2.0
+cython~=0.29.36```
